contextId.information: Here "cup" refers to the cup and the wine in it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: a cup

contextId.information: Here "kingdom" refers to God's rule as king. AT: "when my Father establishes his rule on earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in my Father's kingdom

contextId.information: Here "cup" is a metonym that stands for the cup and the contents within it. The contents in the cup are a metaphor for the suffering that Jesus will have to endure. Jesus is asking the Father if it is possible for him not to have to suffer and die in the way Jesus knows he will in Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: let this cup pass from me

contextId.information: Here "spirit" is a metonym that stands for a person's desires. And, "flesh" refers to a human as a whole. Jesus means they may have the desire to do what God wants, but as humans they are weak and will fail. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak

contextId.information: Here "hands" refers to power or control. AT: "and is handing him over to the power of sinners" or "and is giving him over to sinners" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: into the hands of sinners

contextId.information: This refers to those among the people of Israel who paid to kill Jesus. AT: "some of the people of Israel" or "the leaders of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the people of Israel

contextId.information: Here "word" refers to a message. AT: "sent a message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: sent word

contextId.information: Here "blood" is a metonym that stands for a person's death. The phrase "be on us and our children" is an idiom that means they accept the responsibility of what is happening.  AT: "Yes! We and our descendants will be responsible for executing him!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: May his blood be on us and our children

contextId.information: Here "nations" refers to the people. AT: "of all the people in every nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: of all the nations
